paper.paper_title: Creating large, high-quality geospatial datasets from historical maps using novice volunteers
paper.research_context: Crowdsourced digitization of archaeological features from historical maps using mobile GIS platform (FAIMS Mobile) deployed during field archaeology project in Bulgaria

timeline.prior_work: 2008-2016 TRAP catalogued 773 mounds in Kazanlak Valley and 431 mounds in Yambol region using pedestrian surface survey

location.broader_project: Tundzha Regional Archaeological Project (TRAP) - middle and upper Tundzha River watershed in Bulgaria since 2008

resources.equipment: mobile devices (only 2 of 12 students brought computers, all had mobile devices)
resources.software: FAIMS Mobile platform (open-source, customizable Android application)

track_record.prior_FAIMS_use: previously used for student-led ceramics recording project and improved recording efficiency in other settings
